How to Use Our Investment Calculator

  1. Enter Initial Investment: Input the amount you want to invest initially
  2. Set Monthly Contributions: Enter how much you plan to invest monthly
  3. Choose Investment Term: Select the number of years you plan to invest
  4. Set Expected Return: Enter your expected annual return rate
  5. View Results: See your projected investment growth and total returns

Investment Growth Formula

Your investment growth is calculated using compound interest:

Future Value = P × (1 + r)^n + PMT × [((1 + r)^n - 1) / r]

Where: P = Initial investment, r = Monthly return rate, n = Number of months, PMT = Monthly contribution

Frequently Asked Questions

How does compound interest work in investments?

Compound interest means you earn returns not only on your initial investment but also on the returns you've already earned. This creates exponential growth over time, making it one of the most powerful wealth-building tools.

What's the difference between simple and compound interest?

Simple interest is calculated only on the principal amount, while compound interest is calculated on the principal plus any previously earned interest. Compound interest grows your money much faster over long periods.

How much should I invest monthly?

The amount depends on your financial goals, income, and expenses. A common rule is to invest 10-20% of your income, but start with what you can afford and increase over time. Even small amounts can grow significantly with compound interest.

What's a realistic expected return rate?

Historical stock market returns average around 7-10% annually, but this varies by investment type and time period. Conservative investments might return 3-5%, while aggressive growth investments might target 10-12% or higher.

How does time affect investment growth?

Time is the most powerful factor in investment growth due to compound interest. Starting early, even with smaller amounts, often results in more wealth than starting later with larger amounts due to the exponential nature of compound growth.

Investment Calculator Features

  • Compound Interest Calculation: See how your money grows over time
  • Monthly Contribution Planning: Plan regular investment contributions
  • Return Rate Analysis: Compare different expected return scenarios
  • Time Horizon Planning: Understand the impact of investment duration

Investment Planning Tips

  • Start investing as early as possible to maximize compound interest
  • Invest consistently, even small amounts add up over time
  • Diversify your investments across different asset classes
  • Consider your risk tolerance when choosing investments
  • Reinvest dividends and returns to accelerate growth
  • Review and adjust your investment strategy regularly
  • Consider tax-advantaged accounts like IRAs and 401(k)s
  • Don't try to time the market - focus on long-term growth
